title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (27).

title: Sri Lanka backs global disarmament, warns against AI weaponization
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath says that Sri Lanka supports legally binding Negative Security Assurances for non-nuclear states and advocates for the establishment of Nuclear Weapon-Free Zones, particularly in the Middle East.

title: Trump administration says it’s cutting 90% of USAID foreign aid contracts
byline: The Trump administration said Wednesday it is eliminating more than 90% of the U.S. Agency for International Development’s foreign aid contracts and $60 billion in overall U.S. assistance around the world.

title: Govt. nurses protest allowance cuts in 2025 Budget
byline: The Government Nursing Officers’ Association has decided to stage a demonstration in front of government hospitals across the island during the lunch hour today (27).

title: Committee Stage of 2025 Appropriation Bill kicks off today
byline: The debate on the Committee Stage or the Third Reading of the 2025 Appropriation Bill, or the 79th Budget Speech, is scheduled to kick off today (Feb. 27) in parliament.

title: Hamas hands over bodies of four hostages, Israel frees Palestinian prisoners
byline: Hamas handed over the bodies of four Israeli hostages while it waited for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners to be released by Israel in return, in an overnight exchange marking the final swap as part of a fragile truce in Gaza.

title: Michelle Trachtenberg, Gossip Girl and Buffy actress, dies aged 39
byline: Actress Michelle Trachtenberg, who rose to fame as a child star in the 1990s and 2000s, has died aged 39.

title: ‘World’s first mobile renewable energy’ prepares to set sail
byline: Wind power has been rising significantly in recent years, and now accounts for about 8% of the world’s energy production. By the end of the decade, it will be the second-largest renewable source after solar, having surpassed hydropower, according to the International Energy Agency.

title: Another suspect arrested over fatal shooting at Uswetakeiyawa Beach
byline: Another suspect connected to the fatal shooting of a man at Uswetakeiyawa Beach in the Pamunugama Police Division has been arrested by the police.

title: EC convenes to decide on LG Polls date
byline: The Election Commission is scheduled to convene today (27) for a meeting while it is reported that a decision regarding the date of the Local Government (LG) Elections is expected to be made during this meeting.

title: Ex-President Ranil heads to India for third visit in recent months
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is set to depart for New Delhi, India, today (27) to deliver a keynote address on global issues.

title: Minister issues clarification over 15% tax on digital service exports
byline: Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando addressed concerns regarding the taxation of individuals earning foreign revenue through digital services.

title: Possible water supply disruptions due to high demand; bowsers to reach affected areas
byline: The Water Supply and Drainage Board has cautioned the public about possible low water pressure and supply disruptions, particularly in high-altitude areas, due to a surge in water consumption.

title: Central Bank warns against unauthorized use of ‘Finance’ in business names
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a warning against the use of word ‘Finance’ in business names.

title: Ex-Presidents’ expenditure on foreign trips revealed; Mahinda tops list
byline: During today’s (27) parliamentary session, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya revealed the total expenditure on foreign trips made by former Presidents of Sri Lanka.

title: Iraj arrives at Welikada Police over probe into complaint against him
byline: Music Producer Iraj Weeraratne had arrived at the Welikada Police Station this morning (27) for further investigations into a complaint filed by an individual against him.
